motions.title: Initial Motion to Transmit Comprehensive Plan
motions.description: Motion to transmit the draft 2025-2045 Comprehensive Plan to the Atlanta Regional Commission and the Georgia Department of Community Affairs for review.

motions.title: Amendment to Remove North Peachtree Road from Neighborhood Transition Opportunities
motions.description: Amendment to pull and strike North Peachtree Road from page 80 with all regards to the neighborhood transition opportunities in the Comprehensive Plan.

motions.title: Amendment to Remove All Language on Neighborhood Transition Opportunities
motions.description: Motion to remove all language on neighborhood transition opportunities listed on page 80 mentioned as opportunities in the community agenda and all other sections from the Comprehensive Plan.

motions.title: Perimeter Character Area Amendment - Move Uses to Yellow Category
motions.description: Amendment to move senior/assisted living, multi-unit, mixed use, and regional commercial to the yellow category and move small lot residential to yellow with appropriate consideration.

motions.title: Perimeter Character Area - MARTA TOD Language Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to rewrite the first bullet under projects and initiatives to read 'Work with PCID and MARTA to implement appropriate transit-oriented development on Dunwoody MARTA Station property.'

motions.title: Perimeter Transition Character Area Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to move mixed use and senior assisted living to the yellow appropriate with considerations category.

motions.title: Dunwoody Village Character Area Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to move senior assisted living and mixed use to the yellow category.

motions.title: Dunwoody Village Transition Character Area Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to move senior assisted living to the yellow category appropriate with considerations.

motions.title: Georgetown West Character Area Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to move senior assisted living and mixed use to the yellow category appropriate considerations.

motions.title: Georgetown West Transition Character Area Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to shift senior/assisted living to the yellow category appropriate with considerations.

motions.title: Georgetown East Character Area Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to move senior/assisted living and multi-unit uses to the yellow category appropriate with considerations.

motions.title: Georgetown East First Baptist Church Reference Removal
motions.description: Amendment to strike the line 'most of the area consists of First Baptist Church of Atlanta and its adjacent adjoining parking lots.'

motions.title: Winters Chapel Character Area Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to move senior/assisted living, multi-unit, and mixed use to the yellow category, appropriate with considerations, and add a small area plan with adjacent jurisdictions for Winters Chapel and Peachtree Boulevard.

motions.title: Winters Chapel Transition Character Area Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to shift senior/assisted living to the yellow category, appropriate with considerations.

motions.title: Jett Ferry Character Area Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to move senior/assisted living, mixed use, and medium density commercial to the yellow category, appropriate with considerations.

motions.title: Ashford Character Area Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to move senior/assisted living to the yellow category, appropriate with considerations.

motions.title: Ashford Character Area Mixed-Use Amendment (Failed)
motions.description: Amendment to move mixed-use and multi-unit from yellow appropriate with consideration, to red inappropriate.

motions.title: Peachtree Boulevard Character Area Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to move senior/assisted living, multi-unit, and mixed use to the yellow category, appropriate with consideration.

motions.title: Civic Campuses Character Area Removal Amendment (Failed)
motions.description: Amendment to remove Civic Campuses from the document.

motions.title: Amendment to Remove Brook Run Character Area from Document
motions.description: Amendment to remove the Brook Run character area section from the Comprehensive Plan document.

motions.title: Water Works Character Area Removal Amendment (Failed)
motions.description: Amendment to strike water works from the document as a specific section and keeping text as appropriate in the plan.

motions.title: SLUP Requirement Amendment
motions.description: Amendment that in any situation on land use charts where it requires additional review process, they would require a SLUP.

motions.title: Civic Campuses Character Area Uses Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to move from Civic Campuses character area public/institution and senior assisted living from green down to yellow.

motions.title: Community Work Plan Bikeshare Removal Amendment
motions.description: Amendment to remove project T.11 Endorse/assist with bikeshare program from the Community Work Plan section.

motions.title: Final Motion to Submit Comprehensive Plan as Amended
motions.description: Motion to submit the Comprehensive Plan as amended to the Atlanta Regional Commission and the Georgia Department of Community Affairs for review.

motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda including: • Approval of July 14, 2025 City Council Meeting Minutes • Approval of a Construction Contract for Old Springhouse Lane Path (Michelle Hirose) • Municipal Court Probation Services Contract Renewal (Norlaundra Huntington)

motions.title: Holiday HQ Proposal
motions.description: Approval of Holiday HQ proposal with a financial commitment from the city of $25,000 for a collaborative project with Discover Dunwoody and the PCIDs.

motions.title: Motion to Adjourn
motions.description: Motion to adjourn the meeting.

publicHearings.title: Consent to Transmit Draft 2025-2045 Comprehensive Plan to the ARC and the Georgia Department of Community Affairs for Review
publicHearings.description: First public hearing for the Comprehensive Plan for approval to transmit the plan to the Atlanta Regional Commission and the Georgia Department of Community Affairs for review. Multiple speakers opposed the plan citing concerns about density and traffic. One speaker in favor.
